creator: snakamura@infoteria.co.jp
text:
locale attribute on javadoc element doesn't work when it appers after other 
attributes.

-locale option of javadoc command must be specified before doclet specific 
options such as -d, but ant generate these command line below:

javadoc -d docs -locale en ....

when I wrote build.xml like this:

<javadoc sourcepath="..." destdir="..." locale="en" ..../>

When I change the order of attributes like below:

<javadoc locale="en" sourcepath="..." destdir="..." .../>

it works well. However, I thinks it must not depend on an order of attributes.

I uses JDK 1.3.1 on Windows platform.

creator: jsdever@sympatico.ca
text:
I had a similar problem with java1.4rc.  It appears that the order of the
argumennts to javadoc are important.  Case in point -locale must be the first
argument.

    <javadoc destdir="${osf.dir}/docs/api"
             sourcepath="${source.dir}:${test.source.dir}"
	     classpath="${classpath}"
	     packagenames="ost.osf"
	     access="private"
             locale="en_CA"
	     failonerror="yes"
    />

  [javadoc] Generating Javadoc
  [javadoc] Javadoc args: /usr/local/j2sdk1.4.0/jre/../bin/javadoc -d ...
-private -locale en_CA -classpath ... -sourcepath ... -version -author ost.osf
  [javadoc] Javadoc execution
  [javadoc] javadoc: option -locale must be first on the command line.
